heaviest_rainfall.status: 47.89mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 09 November 2025, marking an exceptional 144.8 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 24.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 34.3mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 09 November 2025, it lasted 144.8 hours and it delivered 47.89mm of rain at a maximum rate of 24.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: An active storm has been detected in the vicinity.  The last storm experienced was on 02 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 3 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.6.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 0 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is westerly (252°).  In the UK, a westerly wind generally brings wet and windy conditions from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 128.2 mph on 27 January 2026.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the inside temperature (down 2.6°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 1.6 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 203 m), feels like temperature (down 2.7°C), outside temperature (down 2.0°C), and inside temperature (up 2.5°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 65.1m lower than yesterday, 203.4m lower than the past week, 189.1m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 523m minimum and 933m maximum, with an average of 579.0m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 782.4m and 768.1m.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures may feel cool outdoors. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and winds will be practically absent. Drizzle or light rain possible, overcast skies with low cloud, and it’s dark. Changeable conditions.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
